result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Davion Marquez Mclemore

records.addlTxt:
Court lifts no contact provision with A.B.
All other conditions remain.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Davion Marquez Mclemore in court.  
Prosecuting attorney Natalie M. Mulvey in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant to contact SPD to see if he qualifies for an attorney
Victim A.B. appears and wants no contact lifted; State takes no position; court lifts no contact with A.B.
Indigency hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Golden House papers - Voluntary Request to Modify and/or remove a no contact release condition.

Defendant already posted $150 bond at jail. Bond out. 
Defendant to have no contact with A.B. or their residence or place of employment.
Third party may arrange child placement/visitation. 
Third party may pick up personal belongings. 
Defendant to possess no weapons.

Defendant Davion Marquez Mclemore in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jill A Engel in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant's legal rights, meaning of charge, possible penalties and right to trial by jury explained.  Defendant is advised of right to counsel. 
Defendant is referred to Public Defender.  Defendant advised of procedure to obtain court-appointed counsel, form given.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
